intro: Hieracium lorophyllum, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in summer, and it produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium lorophyllum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
